title: Home Page - Personal website of Juliette Tariel-Adam
text:
üôÇ Hi there, thanks for visiting my personal website.
üêü I am an early-career researcher interested in evolution, marine biology, and animal behaviour. I‚Äôm fascinated by fish and marine life in general.
üëÄ I‚Äôm looking for a new postdoctoral research position focused on fish behaviour and cognition, ideally working on behavioural traditions of coral reef fish. Feel free to contact me to connect.
üìç I currently hold an honorary postdoctoral position at Macquarie University. I work on a project about fishes that use tools remotely from France. See all my current and past projects here.
‚ú® I‚Äôm also involved in the scientific society SORTEE, where I serve on the board of directors, the conference committee, and the DEI committee. See my committments here towards a science that is respectful and caring to all humans and living beings.

title: Open science
text:
open science practices
Travelling to conferences by train
Avoid buying and reusing Make an inventory before Take time to ask different labs about their resources rather than buying new ones
Long lasting computer
Online conferences

title: Open science
text:
Ongoing commitments

Carefully analyse most ethical journals Link to the table ## Past initiatives Open science practices

‚Ä¢ Active member of SORTEE (Society for Open, Reliable and Transparent biology in Ecology and Evolution) - 2025: Chair, Conference Committee - 2023-2024: Program Manager, Conference Committee ‚Ä¢ Volunteer for Peer Community In (PCI) - 2024-2025: Article formatting - 2025: Data and script reviewing ‚Ä¢ Commitment to ethical scientific publishing - Published the final paper from my PhD in Peer Community Journal - For my first postdoctoral paper, I could not find an ideal journal in marine biology, so I chose Coral Reefs, which is at least supported by a scientific society ## Future commitments

title: Open science
text:
Ongoing commitments

Member of the DEI committee in the scientific society SORTEE
Check digital accessibility in my papers (use of color blindness simulator, provide alt text for images, text and contrast big enough, meaningful hyperlink texts)

text:
üíª Statistical analysis

Linear models in R including generalised and mixed models

Survival analysis in R
Quantitative analysis
